intro: Pentopetia bidens, commonly known as the two-toothed pentopetia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
